intro: Potentilla algida, commonly known as alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five to seven oval-shaped leaflets. Potentilla algida thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons.
